project.teaser: TREASoURcE will innovatively circulate currently incinerated, exported, landfilled or dumped plastic and biobased side and waste streams by deploying systemic circular economy (CE) solutions. The systemic CE solutions will integrate the two main elements of TREASoURcE:...
project.objective: TREASoURcE will innovatively circulate currently incinerated, exported, landfilled or dumped plastic and biobased side and waste streams by deploying systemic circular economy (CE) solutions. The systemic CE solutions will integrate the two main elements of TREASoURcE: stakeholder engagement demonstrations (SE-DEMOs) and key value chain demonstrations (KVC-DEMOs). The DEMOs support chosen territory clusters in introducing CE practices to their citizens and businesses to help 1) decouple from use of fossil virgin resources and excess raw material consumption, 2) increase resilience (self-sufficiency, value chain security, environment and nature), 3) decrease GHG emissions and contribute to achieve climate neutral economies. Climate change, environmental degradation and loss of biodiversity are major global threats that require urgent collaborative actions across industry, sectors, cities and regions, communities and citizens. Half of total GHG emissions and more than 90 % of biodiversity loss come from resource extraction and processing. Global consumption of materials, especially biomass, fossil fuels, metals and minerals are expected to double by 2060 and annual waste generation is estimated to increase by 70 % by 2050. TREASoURcE focuses on demonstrating the CE solutions in cities and regions located in the Nordics (Finland, Sweden, Norway and Denmark), and they will be replicated in the Baltics (Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania), Poland and Germany (of the Baltic Sea Region). The combination of the cities and regions will enable large reach and bigger impact and boost the replicability and scalability potential of the CE solutions. A common issue of the regions’ material circulation is low and decentralised material volumes and resulting challenges in feasibility, and bottlenecks have been high risk investments due challenges in securing sufficient feedstock (quality and quantity). However, regional strengths lie in ambitious climate and environmental targets.
project.title: TERRITORIAL AND REGIONAL DEMONSTRATIONS OF SYSTEMIC SOLUTIONS OF KEY VALUE CHAINS AND THEIR REPLICATION TO DEPLOY CIRCULAR ECONOMY
project.keywords: Plastics, biogasification, batteries, recycling, reuse, job creation, business opportunities, resource sufficiency, social innovation, rural development, urban development, value chains, co-creation

result.title: Development of methods to test the battery condition and verify state of health
result.description: Report on the investigation of new methods for establishing state of health of the batteries and the development of methods for testing battery conditions to verify state of health. Final report for T4.1.

result.title: Joint CCRI deliverable 2
result.description: To be confirmed during the project. This deliverable will describe potential synergies and joint achievements with the project SYSCHEMIQ which is issued from the same topic (CIRCBIO-01-01). The nature of the joint work will be further defined during the project but may include joint policy feedback such as policy brief or white paper. Relates to T9.5.

result.title: Compilation of task reports
result.description: Task reports compiled in one deliverable. Reports T1.4.Compilation of public reports.These reports will present the review of the state-of-the art of technology and best practices for circular strategies in the targeted value chains, practices and framework for eco-design and circular business models. The report will include an analysis of the current state (existing literature, interviews), and opportunities and bottlenecks for CE highlighted. The report will also include a review of relevant technologies relating to reuse and recycling of targeted key value chains from a value chain perspective: collection, logistics, separation, pre-treatments, processing, and upgrading.

result.title: Report on funding, public and private investments and building investment pipelines
result.description: A report on supporting securing funding and public and private investments, and building investment pipelines for CE innovations. Relates to T6.5.

result.title: Legislative and regulatory framework for target value chains
result.description: A review of the legislative and regulatory framework affecting the circularity of targeted value chains in the TREASoURcE territories. This deliverable is likely to provide input for policy recommendations. Relates to T1.3.

result.title: Plan for communication
result.description: Plan for project communication. Relates to T8.1.

result.title: Website
result.description: This deliverable reports on the project website, relating to T8.1.

result.title: Report on territories' logistics, value chains and material flows obtained in WP3-6
result.description: Report on analysis of TREASoURcE territories' key value chain related key findings on current and state-of-the-art logistics and value chains, as well as an analysis of the material flows available in the territories from the targeted raw materials. Relates to T1.2.

result.title: Territories' CE activities and state-of-the-art
result.description: Report on TREASoURcE territories' (Nordic + Baltic Sea Region) circular economy activities and the state-of-the-art analysis on status of current circular economy in the key value chains. Relates to T1.1.

result.title: CE marketplace and value chain models
result.description: The CE marketplace and value chain models will be described as a demonstration. Relates to T5.1 and T5.2.

result.title: Handbook on best practices for communicating with important stakeholders to support CE transition
result.description: Handbook on best practices for communicating with important stakeholders like citizens, students, communities, workforce, public bodies, decision makers, and industry to support CE transition. Relates to T8.2.

result.title: Joint CCRI deliverable 1
result.description: To be confirmed during the project. This deliverable will describe potential synergies and joint achievements with the project SYSCHEMIQ which is issued from the same topic (CIRCBIO-01-01). The nature of the joint work will be further defined during the project but may include joint policy feedback such as policy brief or white paper. Relates to T9.5.

result.title: Report on digitalisation, logistics and spatial optimization
result.description: Report describing the characteristics of optimising digitalisation, logistics and spatial conditions to support CE replication.Relates to T6.3 and T6.4.

result.title: Report on core and extended framework for sustainability and CE of systemic solutions
result.description: Report on core and extended framework developed in TREASoURcE aimed for sustainability and CE of systemic solutions. Relates to T7.3.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - TREASoURcE (TERRITORIAL AND REGIONAL DEMONSTRATIONS OF SYSTEMIC SOLUTIONS OF KEY VALUE CHAINS AND THEIR REPLICATION TO DEPLOY CIRCULAR ECONOMY)
result.description: periodic
result.teaser: TREASoURcE is focusing on implemeting different circular economy strategies like repurposing, reuse and recycling to currently non-circulating and underutilised plastic, batteries and biobased side and waste streams. We develop systemic circular economy solutions. The systemic...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Existing and upcoming challenges for extending electric vehicle battery lifetime through 2nd life applications

details.authors: Fride Vullum-Bruer, Olav Galteland, Margaux Gouis, Nina McDougall, Anna Tenhunen-Lunkka

result.title: Report on optimising collection and logistics of plastic waste, boos-ting recycling and uptake of products made from recycled plastics
result.description: Report on optimising collection and logistics of plastic waste, boosting recycling and uptake of products made from recycled plastics based on TREASoURCE findings in the territories. Relates to T3.1.

result.title: Cambridge Journal of Regions, Economy and Society

details.authors: Mari Wardeberg; Henrik Brynthe Lund; Jens Hanson; Riina Kärki; Linda Rekosuo; Anna Tenhuen-Lunkka; Sarianna Palola
details.journalTitle: Cambridge Journal of Regions, Economy and Society

result.title: Workshop report including local CE conditions analysis
result.description: Report on T6.1 workshop outcomes and analysis and tools to analyse local CE conditions. Relates to T6.1.

result.title: Guidance booklet on the CE concept(s) for event organisers and a separate guidance document for event funding authorities
result.description: Guidance document/booklet based on the TREASoURcE findings from the stakeholder demonstrations to support implementing sustainable circular practices and concepts into events. Includes two parts: one for event organisers and one for funding authorities like public bodies that can implement circularity related terms into event funding conditions. This deliverable is likely to provide input for policy recommendations. Relates to T2.2.

result.title: Value chain models, mapping, and procedures
result.description: Value chain models will be described as a demonstration, streams mapped and procedures demonstrated. Relates to T5.1 and T5.2.

result.title: Scope of learning materials to support CE training
result.description: TREASoURcE key value chain related teaching and learning materials to promote and teach about circular economy to children, youth and young adults. Relates to T2.2.

result.title: Report on existing and upcoming challenges for 2nd life battery use
result.description: Report on the analyses and research on existing and upcoming challenges and bottlenecks affecting 2nd life batteries reuse. Relates to T4.1.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
